question_stem.en: A 32-year-old woman, gravida 1 para 0, at 35 weeks gestation comes to the emergency department due to absent fetal movement for the past 24 hours. The patient has had no prenatal care. Fetal ultrasonography confirms an intrauterine fetal demise. Autopsy examination of the fetus reveals incomplete separation of the cerebral hemispheres with a single ventricle, as shown in the image below: {{exhibit_1}}
question_stem.zh: 一名32岁的女性，孕1产0，妊娠35周，因过去24小时未感觉到胎动而就诊于急诊科。患者未接受产前护理。胎儿超声检查证实宫内胎儿死亡。胎儿尸检显示大脑半球未完全分离，只有一个脑室，如下图所示：{{exhibit_1}}

question.en: Which of the following is most closely associated with this fetal condition?
question.zh: 以下哪项与这种胎儿状况最相关？

explanation.en:
Holoprosencephaly

Embryology

Incomplete forebrain (prosencephalon) division into 2 hemispheres
Etiologies

Genetic: Trisomy 13, sonic hedgehog gene mutations
Environmental: maternal alcohol use, retinoic acid
Clinical features

CNS abnormalities
Range from asymptomatic to seizures, severe intellectual disability, death
Midface abnormalities
Range from mild hypotelorism and cleft lip/palate to cyclopia, primitive nose, facial cleft

Fetal brain development begins at week 3, when the ectodermal cells thicken and invaginate to form the neural tube, which differentiates into the primitive forebrain (prosencephalon), midbrain (mesencephalon), and hindbrain (rhombencephalon). The prosencephalon gives rise to the diencephalon, which develops into the thalamus and third ventricle, and telencephalon, which develops into the cerebral hemispheres and lateral ventricles.

This fetus has an incomplete separation of the cerebral hemispheres with a single lateral ventricle consistent with holoprosencephaly, a condition in which the forebrain fails to completely divide into right and left hemispheres. Disease severity and midline facial malformations (eg, facial clefts, cyclopia) are dependent upon the degree of hemisphere division; mild forms can be asymptomatic whereas severe cases can be lethal (as in this case).

Holoprosencephaly may be due to a variety of factors (eg, sonic hedgehog gene mutations); the most common associated chromosomal abnormality is trisomy 13 (Patau syndrome). Other midline defects of trisomy 13 include microcephaly, microphthalmia, cleft lip/palate, and omphalocele. Cardiac abnormalities are also common, and cutis aplasia (scalp defect) is characteristic. The majority of affected fetuses die in utero.

(Choice A) Congenital rubella syndrome may be fatal in utero or present in neonates with the characteristic triad of sensorineural hearing loss, cataracts, and congenital heart disease (eg, patent ductus arteriosus). Although CNS infection can result in microcephaly, holoprosencephaly is rare.

(Choice B) Zika virus infection in utero causes infection of neural progenitor cells, resulting in impaired fetal brain development. Due to the destruction of the neurons, patients with congenital Zika virus infection typically have microcephaly, intracranial calcifications (a sign of tissue necrosis), and ventriculomegaly; holoprosencephaly is uncommon with Zika infection.

(Choice C) Maternal lithium use is classically associated with fetal cardiac abnormalities (eg, Ebstein anomaly), not neurologic structural defects.

(Choice E) Trisomy 21 (Down syndrome) can cause ventriculomegaly and decreased brain volume, but patients still have 2 separate cerebral hemispheres and ventricles (not holoprosencephaly).

Educational objective:
Holoprosencephaly is due to failure of the primitive forebrain (prosencephalon) to divide into the right and left hemispheres, resulting in a spectrum of brain and midface abnormalities (eg, facial clefts, cyclopia). Trisomy 13 is the most commonly associated etiology. {{exhibit_2}} {{exhibit_3}} {{exhibit_4}} {{exhibit_5}}
explanation.zh:
全前脑无裂畸形

胚胎学

前脑（端脑）未完全分裂成两个半球
病因学

遗传：13三体综合征，刺猬基因突变
环境：母亲饮酒，维甲酸
临床特征

中枢神经系统异常
从无症状到癫痫发作、严重智力障碍、死亡
面中部异常
从轻度眼距过宽和唇/腭裂到独眼畸形、原始鼻、面部裂隙

胎儿大脑发育始于第3周，外胚层细胞增厚并内陷形成神经管，神经管分化为原始前脑（端脑）、中脑（间脑）和后脑（菱脑）。前脑产生间脑，间脑发育成丘脑和第三脑室，端脑发育成大脑半球和侧脑室。

该胎儿的大脑半球未完全分离，只有一个侧脑室，这与全前脑无裂畸形一致，这是一种前脑未能完全分裂成左右半球的疾病。疾病的严重程度和中线面部畸形（如，面部裂隙、独眼畸形）取决于半球分裂的程度；轻度形式可以无症状，而严重病例可能致命（如本例）。

全前脑无裂畸形可能由于多种因素（如，刺猬基因突变）引起；最常见的相关染色体异常是13三体综合征（帕陶综合征）。13三体综合征的其他中线缺陷包括小头畸形、小眼症、唇/腭裂和脐膨出。心脏异常也很常见，皮肤发育不全（头皮缺陷）是其特征。大多数受影响的胎儿在子宫内死亡。

（选项A）先天性风疹综合征可能导致宫内死亡或在新生儿中表现为特征性的感觉神经性听力损失、白内障和先天性心脏病（如，动脉导管未闭）。虽然中枢神经系统感染可导致小头畸形，但全前脑无裂畸形很少见。

（选项B）宫内寨卡病毒感染会导致神经祖细胞感染，导致胎儿大脑发育受损。由于神经元的破坏，先天性寨卡病毒感染的患者通常患有小头畸形、颅内钙化（组织坏死的迹象）和脑室扩大；寨卡病毒感染引起的脑前脑无裂畸形并不常见。

（选项C）母亲使用锂盐通常与胎儿心脏异常（如，Ebstein畸形）相关，而不是神经系统结构缺陷。

（选项E）21三体综合征（唐氏综合征）可引起脑室扩大和脑容量减少，但患者仍有两个独立的大脑半球和脑室（而非全前脑无裂畸形）。

教育目标：
全前脑无裂畸形是由于原始前脑（端脑）未能分裂成左右半球，导致一系列大脑和面中部异常（如，面部裂隙、独眼畸形）。13三体综合征是最常见的相关病因。{{exhibit_2}} {{exhibit_3}} {{exhibit_4}} {{exhibit_5}}

summary.en:
This question tests knowledge of holoprosencephaly, a congenital brain malformation, and its association with genetic and environmental factors, particularly trisomy 13. It also requires differentiating holoprosencephaly from other conditions causing fetal demise and CNS abnormalities. 

The best approach is to recognize the autopsy findings of incomplete cerebral hemisphere separation and single ventricle, linking it to holoprosencephaly. Then, recall that trisomy 13 (Patau syndrome) is the most common genetic association. Eliminate other options based on their distinct clinical and pathological features.
summary.zh:
这道题考察了对全前脑无裂畸形的了解，这是一种先天性脑畸形，以及它与遗传和环境因素的关系，特别是13三体综合征。它还需要将全前脑无裂畸形与其他导致胎儿死亡和中枢神经系统异常的疾病区分开来。

最好的方法是识别尸检结果，即大脑半球未完全分离和单个脑室，将其与全前脑无裂畸形联系起来。然后，回想起13三体综合征（帕陶综合征）是最常见的遗传关联。根据其他选项独特的临床和病理特征来排除它们。
